name: Eurodesk Brussels Link
goal:
“Raising awareness among young people on mobility opportunities and encouraging them to become active citizens.”

Eurodesk is the main provider of information on European policies and opportunities for young people and those who work with them.

Eurodesk is designed for professionals who work with young people. Eurodesk is the most comprehensive and most accessible source of youth information about European opportunities. Eurodesk staff and Eurodesk multipliers inspire and give support to young people in their mobility projects as well as in their willingness to become active citizens of Europe.”

Eurodesk Brussels Link (EBL) is the coordinating body of the Eurodesk network and also the managing body of the Eurodesk brand.

EBL ensures that the activities of the Eurodesk centres are aligned with the organisationís overall objectives, mission and brand.
EBL gives technical support to Eurodesk centres.
EBL provides first-hand and high-quality European information on youth mobility as well as tools for training, information management, quality assessment and communication.
EBL supports the European Commission in developing and maintaining the European Youth Portal, regularly editing European contents, assessing the quality and measuring the level of performance of Eurodesk centres.
EBL represents the Eurodesk network towards the European Commission and other EU stakeholders.

Within the framework of the new programme Erasmus+ Eurodesk has a specific role as part of the Key action 3: “Support for policy reform”.
interests: Communication, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Enlargement, Environment, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Research and innovation, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: European Youth Portal; Erasmus+; Social Dialogue; Solidarity Corps; DiscoverEU; TimeToMove
